name: Orrus Ironheart
text_appearance:
• Short black hair spiked upwards with a fade along this sides

  • Broad shoulders and big build - 6'3'' with a mechanic right eye that looks almost the same as his organic one

  • long scar across his face that goes past his nose and upper right lip

  • well-kept stubble

  • Union uniform, properly tucked and groomed

  • Bionic right foot (war wound)
history:
• Part of multiple FFTs in the past of varying sizes

  • Was born on Cradle and grew up with a father who was involved in Union-Cradle politics, trusts Union completely and utterly defends their cause.

  • But his first FFT were his people, found family. FFT 0301 - Streya, Warlock and Obsidian. Team 0301 served together for 7 years. After a brutal incident involving Horus and a dying star, they all went missing.

  • He continues to serve as a cosmopolitan, hoping to make something of his life, exploring the stars with the quiet hope of reuniting with his original team some day, the only real connections he holds onto. He remains an optimistic leader, who aims to protect those around him, in a vow to himself for failing to protect his former teammates.

  • Orrus is kind-hearted, bold, and strong-willed. His time on the battlefield and his ability to get to the root of FFT-related mysteries has garnered him recognition from Union.

  • Although recently, his origins from Cradle spur unto him a mystery that will forever change his life...

  • (What was cradle like when he left to enlist with Union?)

systems.flavorDescription: The GMS Type-3 Projected Shield traps and denies incoming projectiles by projecting an aggressive, superpositional anti-ballistic barrier.

The Armory’s ENCLAVE-Pattern Support Shield creates a localized one-way blinkfield, folding a thin dome of complex realspace around its user and their immediate area, protecting occupants from incoming projectiles. Entities within the field can fire out, but probabilistic fluctuations cause incoming projectiles to “lag”, skipping them away from their intended target and along a randomized trajectory.

weapon.flavorDescription: Developed following costly urban and naval boarding engagements in the Interest War, Shatterhead Colony Missiles are now a standard part of the arsenal fielded by Armory interdiction teams. When they reach an optimal distance, Shatterheads break open in a burst of high-catalyst fuel to reveal a cluster of small thermobaric pellets that spread out and ignite, choking the affected area with flame. The effect overloads energy shielding and saturates cover, though only a small percent of the projectiles actually reach their target.

Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-III (T-3) line is made up of heavy weapons, ordnance, and other exotic, specialized, or massive weapons. A broad classification, the T-3 range includes conventional-kinetic anti-materiel rifles, super-rapid cycling pulse rifles, missile racks, cannons, and drone nexuses – “hive”style launchers that serve as miniature factory, hangar, and deployment systems for portable drones. The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.

bondPowers.name: The Wall
bondPowers.description: If you stand in defense of another person, they cannot take Stress while you are still conscious and you remain within arm’s reach. Instead, you take Stress each time they would take stress. You can’t take any action or concentrate on anything else while defending someone.

bondAnswers: A voice and heart of iron, passed down from your mentor.
minorIdeal: I protected someone weaker than myself.

armor.flavorDescription: These hardsuits, common among military units, feature heavier plating than light hardsuits but more mobility than heavy hardsuits. They are powered, augmenting the user’s strength, and typically feature an onboard computer, sensor suite, integrated air, burst EVA system, and waste recycling systems.

weapons.flavorDescription: Heavy signature weapons are missile tubes, heavy lasers, light machine gun, or exotic rifles.
Medium A/C weapons are typically swords, officer’s sabers, and trench axes.

gear.flavorDescription: This clear, plastic-like sheet can be placed over the wounds of severely injured pilots. It instantly begins to stabilize them, injecting medicine and deploying nanites to stitch wounds shut.
“Patch” is pilot slang for any kind of modern first aid gear, including sprayable medi-gel and instant-acting medical patches.
A miniaturized version of Union’s full-scale printers, handheld printers can be used to make simple objects out of flexible and durable plastic – as long as you have the right pattern chip.
